result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice F Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Maurice F Hampton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Maurice F Hampton was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Maurice F Hampton was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*  Pay only the Mandatory costs from bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment, if necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice F Hampton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant  to serve 50 DAYS, to run concurrent as to each count in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS to run concurrent as to each count with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay only the Mandatory costs from bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment, if necessary.
*  No contact with the Walmart Store located at 6300 W. Brown Deer Road, City of Brown Deer, County of Milwaukee, WI.
*  If not previously done so, Defendant is required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Defense requests an adjourned sentencing  date.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.

Court vacates Jury trial date of 2-01-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defendant wishes to resolve.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM041185  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/03/15
All other conditions remain the same.

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address Justice Point violation. Arguments heard as to bail. Court set cash bail at $300.00.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (positive drug test) received and filed.

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Defendant reminded to comply with all conditions of bail. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Maurice F Hampton not in court, in custody.  Morgan Willz supervised by Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requested an adjourned pretrial conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Walmart in Milwaukee County

Defendant Maurice F Hampton in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Maurice F Hampton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.    All parties are advised effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/23/15 @ 1:30pm
